title: Performance Patterns
description: Educational comparisons of efficient vs inefficient query patterns

queries.title: Efficient: Set-Based vs Iterative
queries.description: Demonstrate efficient set-based operations (vs row-by-row processing)
queries.performanceNotes: Set-based operations are 10-100x faster than iterative approaches

queries.title: JOIN vs Subquery Performance
queries.description: Compare JOIN vs correlated subquery performance
queries.performanceNotes: JOINs allow optimizer flexibility; correlated subqueries may execute once per row

queries.title: Index-Friendly Query Patterns
queries.performanceNotes: SARGable predicates enable index usage; functions on columns prevent it

queries.title: Efficient Aggregation with CTEs
queries.performanceNotes: CTE pre-aggregates once; correlated subqueries repeat for each row

queries.title: Avoiding SELECT *
queries.description: Select specific columns instead of SELECT *
queries.performanceNotes: Explicit column lists reduce I/O and enable covering indexes

queries.title: Efficient LIMIT with ORDER BY
queries.description: Efficient use of LIMIT with ORDER BY for top-N queries
queries.performanceNotes: LIMIT allows early termination; large OFFSETs still process skipped rows
